content:
• Thursday, June 4, 2015
  • FTR

    Frontier prices equity offerings; common shares at $5

    • Frontier Communications (NYSE:FTR) has priced the equity offerings that are funding its wireline purchase from Verizon.
    • The company set $750M in common stock at a public offering price of $5/share, and $1.75B in 11.125% Mandatory Convertible Preferred Stock (series A) at $100/share.
    • Underwriters have a 30-day option to purchase up to 15M more shares of common stock and 1.75M more shares of the convertible preferred stock at the public offering price.
    • The offerings are expected to close around next Wednesday, June 10.
    • Shares gave back gains today, falling 7.1% to close at $5.00 even.
    • Previously: Frontier Communications up 6.3% as DA Davidson upgrades (Jun. 03 2015)
    • Previously: Frontier up 2%; sets stock offering to fund Verizon deal (Jun. 02 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 PM | 5 Comments
  • PTN

    Palatin +28.9%; FDA AdComm recommends approving HSDD drug

    • The FDA Advisory Committee has recommended approving flibanserin, a Sprout Pharmaceuticals drug meant to treat women with hypoactive sexual desire disorder (HSDD). The media has often referred to flibanserin as a female Viagra.
    • Palatin (NYSEMKT:PTN), which is currently taking enrollments for Phase 3 trials of its bremelanotide HSDD drug, has jumped to $1.16 in AH trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:09 PM | 13 Comments
  • DTEA

    DAVIDsTEA IPO prices at $19 per share

    • DAVIDsTEA (NASDAQ:DTEA) prices its IPO at $19 per share after the company originally set a range of $14 to $16.
    • The company reported revenue of $142M last year off a store count of 154 in North America.
    • Previously: IPO watch: Tea time for hot consumer sector (June 1)
    • Previously: DAVIDsTEA lifts IPO price range (June 3)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:33 PM | 2 Comments
  • LBTYA

    Liberty Global up 4.7%, Vodafone up 4.2% on report of merger talks

    • Following on John Malone's "great fit" comment, Liberty Global (NASDAQ:LBTYA) is up 4.7% after hours as Bloomberg reports the company's talking with Vodafone (NASDAQ:VOD), up 4.2% now in late trading, about a range of transactions including a straightforward merger -- which would be one of the largest deals ever on enterprise value.
    • Management issues may be a hurdle (to be expected in any discussions involving the role of billionaire Malone), and Liberty has reportedly soured a bit on the talks recently.
    • Aside from a merger, though, the companies could merge their European business or conduct a series of asset swaps.
    • Liberty Global is the largest cable company in the world, with an enterprise value of about $89B. Vodafone has an EV of about $141B.
    • A European asset merger would likely mean that Vodafone looks at spinning off Middle East/Africa operations.
    • Previously: Vodafone-Liberty still good strategy, but not a slam dunk (Jun. 02 2015)
    • Previously: Vodafone stakeholders: More open to Liberty tie-up (May. 28 2015)
    • Previously: Vodafone jumps on Malone comments (May. 20 2015)
    • Previously: Liberty's Malone: Combo with Vodafone would be 'great fit' (May. 19 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:57 PM | 2 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: INO +5.0%. OTC:ANTH +4.3%. SUPN +4.1%. XBIT +3.3%. DMND +3.0%.
    • Top losers: ZUMZ -7.7%. BMRN -2.0%. UTIW -1.7%. CLLS -1.3%. TTPH -1.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 17 Comments
  • VISN

    VisionChina Media gives back gains after wider Q1 loss

    • After two days where its ADRs ran up more than 34%, VisionChina Media (NASDAQ:VISN) is down 5.6% after hours following a fiscal Q1 report where it posted a slightly wider net loss despite revenue that declined more than 30%.
    • The company had previously noted a dispute with Guangzhou Metro Television, where Guangzhou suspended VisionChina's ad placements during contract renegotiations. That conflict helped drive Q4 revenue down 33%, and VisionChina expected a "strong rebound" in Q2 as the placement normalized.
    • Total broadcast hours of 31,635, down from the prior year's 37,620; average ad revenue/broadcast hour was $314, down from a year-ago $543. Average ad minutes per broadcast hour of 6.11, down Y/Y from 7.03.
    • Net loss (non-GAAP) was $8.4M, slightly wider than the prior year's loss of $7.2M. Cash and equivalents were $11.5M, down from Q4's $19.5M.
    • For Q2, the company's expecting ad service revenue of $21.5M-$22.5M (up 29%-32% sequentially).
    • Along with its Baidu collaboration, the company added Baidu's Zhen Xiong, vice general manager of mobile app distribution, to its board.
    • Conference call at 8 p.m. ET.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM | 1 Comment
  • ARO

    Aeropostale +7%; CEO buys 250K shares

    • Aeropostale (NYSE:ARO) CEO Julian Geiger discloses he bought 250K shares over the last two days at prices ranging from $1.85-$2.04.
    • The purchases came with the hard-luck apparel retailer trading close to its 52-week low of $1.70. Shares have jumped to $2.14 in AH trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM | 3 Comments
  • NBGGY

    Greece skipping IMF bond payment tomorrow

    • The news hit after Athens stock exchange had closed for the session, but GREK closed down 5.9% in a preview of what may be ahead on Friday.
    • It's the first time a developed country has ever missed a payment to the IMF, writes Ambrose Evans-Pritchard, noting the Greek government is invoking an obscure mechanism to bundle all debts due in June and pay them at the end of the month.
    • A caught-off guard IMF (hours earlier, Christine Lagarde was confident the payment would be made on Friday) confirms it's been notified by the Greek government that the entire $1.6B due this month will be paid on June 30.
    • The skipped payment is the clearest sign yet of an escalating crisis, writes AEP, as Syriza refuses to buckle and high statesmanship from Europe is so far absent. Syriza has the money on hand to make the payment, but says it won't burn any more of the country's dwindling cash until a credible bailout offer is on the table.
    • NBG -8.9%
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM | 59 Comments
  • LTBR

    Lightbridge wins South Korea patent for metallic nuclear fuel design

    • Lightbridge (NASDAQ:LTBR) popped 31% in the final half-hour of trading after announcing that South Korea granted a patent covering its multi-lobed metallic fuel rod design and fuel assemblies.
    • LTBR says the patent expands international protection of its proprietary fuel technology with indicated benefits of enhanced reactor safety and improved operating economics.
    • LTBR says Korea represents a significant potential market for its metallic fuel, with 24 operating pressurized water reactors plus 12 reactors either under construction or planned by 2035.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 2 Comments
  • ZOES

    Sales and margins up at Zoe's in Q1

    • Comparable-store sales rose 7.7% for Zoe's Kitchen (NYSE:ZOES) in FQ1.
    • Transaction were up 3.7% during the quarter, while prices were up 1.2%.
    • Restaurant contribution margin +140 bps to 21.7%.
    • Restaurant count +12 Q/Q to 141.
    • Guidance: Zoes expects 2015 revenue of $218M-$223M vs. $2201.M consensus.
    • Previously: Zoe's beats by $0.05, beats on revenue
    • ZOES +3.9% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • GECC

    Bulldog Investors targets Full Circle Capital

    • Full Circle Capital (FULL +0.6%) gets a small late-session pop after Phil Goldstein's Bulldog Investors discloses a 5.69% stake in the company, along with its intention to maybe get in touch with management about ways to boost the stock price.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM | 3 Comments
  • ZOES

    Zoe's beats by $0.05, beats on revenue

    • Zoe's (NYSE:ZOES): FQ1 EPS of $0.04 beats by $0.05.
    • Revenue of $63M (+36.6% Y/Y) beats by $1.48M.
    • Shares +2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • WGP

    Western Gas Equity -8% as Anadarko to sell 2M units in secondary offering

    • Western Gas Equity Partners (WGP -8.2%) tumbles following Anadarko Petroleum's (APC -0.5%) plans, announced late yesterday, for a secondary offering of 2M WGP common equity units.
    • APC also said it will concurrently sell 6.5M of its tangible equity units at $50 a piece, with each consisting of a prepaid equity purchase contract and a senior amortizing note.
    • WGP is an APC subsidiary that was formed to hold partnership interests in Western Gas Partners (WES -2.8%), another APC subsidiary that owns and operates pipeline and other midstream energy assets; APC owns 193.4M WGP units, or 88.3% of its outstanding stock, which would fall to ~87.4% after the upcoming offering is completed.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • WLL

    Deutsche Bank: Opportunities remain in E&P stocks amid unappetizing H2 setup

    • Deutsche Bank says it enters H2 with a neutral outlook for the energy E&P sector and a cautious medium-term view on the commodities as valuations are still above past early cycle multiples.
    • Although early 2015 trends of firming WTI crude prices, improved well productivity, and greater and faster than expected cost reductions provide support for the next cycle, DB sees these factors largely priced into E&P's.
    • But the firm sees selective opportunities in the group, upgrading Whiting Petroleum (WLL -3%) and Bill Barrett (BBG +0.6%) to Buy from Hold, and naming Newfield Exploration (NFX -0.3%) and Energen (EGN -1.9%) as Top Picks.
    • The firm downgrades WPX Energy (WPX -3.5%), which it says faces the challenge of meeting 2016 oil growth expectations against a backdrop of declining H2 volumes as Bakken completions slow and lower cash flow in 2016, and Cimarex Energy (XEC -1.4%) on lower volume growth and FY 2016 cash margins than peers with no support from hedges.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 4 Comments
  • CALM

    Cal-Maine Foods rallies again off avian flu news

    • Shares of Cal-Maine Foods (CALM +1.7%) trade higher after a large chicken farm in Minnesota reports a case of avian flu.
    • Cal-Maine has benefited on pricing with most of the damage from the flu outbreak in states where the company doesn't have flocks.
    • CALM +52% over the last 90 days.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • PHH

    PHH Corp. slides as CFPB takes action over title insurance

    • PHH Corp. (PHH -3.9%) will pay a $109M fine and pay back all reinsurance premiums from on or after July 2008 as the CFPB finds the company illegally referred customers for title insurance in exchange for kickbacks.
    • Previously: CFPB begins proceedings against PHH Corp.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • MNI

    McClatchy up 20% on bullish ad sales outlook

    • McClatchy (NYSEMKT:MNI) moved up to +19.7% largely on a big midday trade, as the company detailed its strategy for investors and updated an outlook for digital-only advertising to grow in the double-digit range.
    • “2015 is the year our digital transformation has taken on an accelerated pace,” said CEO Pat Talamantes. “We are intensely focused on driving non-traditional revenues while also reducing legacy costs.”
    • The firm would focus on reducing debt and expects $25M-$30M in cost savings this year, mainly from cutting print production and distribution budgets. Cash expenses were expected to decline in low- to mid-single digits, while audience revenues were seen to grow in the low single digits.
    • The company is moving aggressively on structure as well, shifting sales forces to target local advertisers with services and adding to its digital sales team.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • CIEN

    Ciena higher after FQ2 beat; guidance in-line

    • Though the Nasdaq is down 1%, Ciena (CIEN +1.4%) remains higher after beating FQ2 estimates on the back of strong packet-optical (integrated Ethernet/optical networking) hardware sales. FQ3 revenue guidance is at $610M-$640M, in-line with a $632.2M consensus.
    • Financials: Boosting FQ2 EPS: Gross margin was 44.4%, +30 bps Q/Q and +130 bps Y/Y, and above guidance of 42%-43%; FQ3 GM guidance is at 43%. Also helping: Operating expenses (non-GAAP) only rose by $1.6M Y/Y (less than 1%) to $207.9M. On a GAAP basis, R&D spend totaled $105.2M, sales/marketing $82.5M, and G&A $30.3M. Adjusted op. margin rose to 10.9% from 6.8% in FQ1 and 6.2% a year ago.
    • Business performance: Converged packet optical revenue (69.6% of total) +21% Y/Y to $432.9M. Packet networking (Ethernet switches) -20% to $53.3M. Optical transport -44% to $16.5M. Software/services +11% to $118.9M.
    • Georgaphic/customer performance: North America was 63.9% of revenue (U.S. was 59.1%), EMEA 16.4%, Asia-Pac 12%, and Caribbean/Latin America 7.7%. AT&T accounted for 19% of sales, and was the sole 10%+ customer. UBS likes the fact North American sales rose 20% Q/Q in spite of AT&T revenue (recently under pressure) remaining roughly flat.
    • Shares made a new 52-week high of $25.49 this morning before pulling back a bit.
    • FQ2 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • DSKX

    DS Healthcare up 20%

    • Thinly traded nano cap DS Healthcare Group (OTC:DSKX +20.3%) is up on a 4x surge in volume. No particular news accounts for the move although the stock has been on a healthy uptrend since late March. The personal health products supplier has more than quadrupled in value since then.
    • Separately, the company filed an S-3 on Tuesday registering 200K shares for sale by RP Innovative Consulting, LLC. The company is paying the consultant in stock pursuant to a contract signed on May 12 for marketing and business development services.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM
  • DRWI

    DragonWave lands multi-million dollar Indian order

    • An unnamed Indian telecom/broadband service provider has placed follow-on orders for DragonWave's (DRWI +0.6%) Horizon Compact+ RF backhaul systems. The DragonWave HFCL Indian JV will provide related services.
    • Last year, DragonWave inked a framework agreement with an Indian carrier to provide several thousand Horizon Compact+ backhaul links to support the carrier's 4G rollout.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM | 3 Comments
  • SNOA

    Oculus up in sync with Ruthigen

    • Thinly traded nano cap Oculus Innovative Sciences (OCLS +38.6%) moves up in tandem with Ruthigen (RTGN +18.1%). Oculus has a 1.65M-share stake in Ruthigen.
    • Separately, OCLS will host a special meeting of shareholders on June 29 to vote on a 1:5 reverse split.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • VISN

    VisionChina Media up 21% in second day of huge gains

    • VisionChina Media (NASDAQ:VISN) ADRs are up strong for the second day, +21.4% on more than 20 times average trading volume.
    • Yesterday, shares rose 19.2%. The out-of-home advertising and Wi-Fi firm reports earnings after the close of U.S. trading today.
    • The company today announced a Baidu-led financing transaction for $11.5M of series A equity for its mobile-Internet affiliate Qianhai Mobile.
    • In the deal, Qianhai Mobile and Baidu will jointly develop and monetize "mobile app distribution and other mobile passenger services powered by Baidu Map."
    • The affiliate has secured exclusive concessions for bus Wi-Fi in 18 cities across China, and provides free Wi-Fi to more than 7.5M commuters per day.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • NEON

    Neonode higher after striking Samsung printer licensing deal

    • Neonode (NEON +2.6%) has struck a licensing deal with Samsung for the use of Neonode's zForce CORE touch UI tech within printers.
    • Neonode already has a printer licensing deal with HP, and signed a tech development agreement with another tier-one printer OEM in January.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM | 4 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: OCLS +34%. SHLO +26%. VISN +21%. MNI +21%. OTC:DSKX +20%. NVSL +15%. WOWO +15%. ICAD +13%. NVET +12%. BH-OLD +11%.
    • Losers: BLFS -12%. OTC:ZAZA -9%. VRTV -9%. SCOK -9%. HK -8%. EVA -8%. KUTV -8%. MCF -7%. CAPN -7%. CBAY -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • LSCC

    Lattice +4.6%; CEO says company open to a sale

    • Three days after larger FPGA rival Altera announced it's being acquired by Intel, Lattice Semi (NASDAQ:LSCC) Darin Billerbeck says his company is open to a sale, per Reuters. Shares have spiked higher in response.
    • In January, Lattice struck a $600M deal to buy video transmitter IC vendor Silicon Image. This morning, FBR called Lattice its #2 chip industry buyout candidate, behind Atmel.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • MRVL

    Cavium +6.2%; Needham upgrades following Computex meetings

    • Needham's Quinn Bolton, upgrading to Buy and setting an $85 target: "Based on meetings with CAVM and several of its supply chain partners at Computex, we are incrementally more positive on the prospects for several of Cavium's new products." Those products include Cavium's ThunderX ARM server/data center appliance CPUs, Xpliant Ethernet switching chips, and LiquidIO IP/security acceleration adapter cards.
    • Regarding ThunderX, Bolton reports (citing partner feedback) it should start ramping in September/October, and that its performance and power draw have "created strong customer interest for compute-intensive workloads." Multiple Xpliant design wins have been scored for both top-of-rack (leaf) and aggregation (spine) data center switches (product launches are expected in 1H16), and the second-gen version of LiquidIO is deemed to address "a significantly larger" market opportunity.
    • Also: FBR has called Cavium its #3 chip industry acquisition candidate for 2015, behind Atmel and Lattice Semi.
    • Shares have made new highs, and (with the help of M&A hopes) are up 94% from an October low of $38.73. They now trade for a lofty 32x 2016E EPS.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • PULM

    Ruthigen up 26% on Honig stake

    • Ultra thinly traded nano cap Ruthigen (RTGN +26%) is up on an 18x surge in volume, albeit on turnover of only 148K shares. No particular news accounts for the move although small cap investor Barry Honig disclosed a 9.9% stake on Tuesday in a 13G filing.
    • Individual investors should be cautious here.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM
  • DRGDF

    Detour Gold reports promising results for Detour Lake mine

    • Detour Gold (OTCPK:DRGDF +1.8%) is higher after releasing an operational update for its flagship Detour Lake gold mine, saying Q2 gold production is expected to come in within guidance of 110K-120K oz.
    • Detour says mill throughput rates averaged 59,370 tons/day over last three months, exceeding design capacity of 55K tons/day, and mining rates averaged 271K tons/day over last three months, exceeding the annual budget rate of 238K tons/day.
    • Raymond James calls Detour’s update “overwhelmingly positive.”
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • ATML

    Atmel +4%; FBR calls company its top semi buyout candidate

    • FBR estimates Atmel (NASDAQ:ATML) has a ~25% chance of being acquired in the next 12 months as chip industry consolidation continues. "In our view, Atmel has an excellent [microcontroller] product portfolio with just two architectures (AVR and ARM), thus is less R&D-intensive and therefore a more favorable [microcontroller] acquisition.
    • FBR also notes Atmel "has one of the oldest and most efficient fabs globally," making it possible for an acquirer with more modern fabs to significantly increase its margins. It estimates Atmel's EPS would rise 61% after post-acquisition synergies are realized, with a bull case of 109%.
    • Shares are within $0.50 of a 52-week high of $9.76. Several Atmel peers have already been bought.
    • Yesterday: Needham reports Silicon Labs has fielded M&A inquiries
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM | 2 Comments
  • CHK

    Time to follow Icahn and buy Chesapeake Energy, Sterman says

    • Chesapeake Energy (CHK -3.8%) shares have been whacked by a third YTD as investors punish energy exploration firms that are considered likely to outspend their operating cash flow this year, but StreetAuthority's David Sterman thinks CHK appears poised to buck the consensus forecast this year and at least get to breakeven.
    • CHK is "clearly healthier than it was a few years ago and is no longer at risk of a balance sheet blow up," Sterman writes, and its "strong base of real estate, coupled with impressive cost controls, could set the stage for a sharp spike in cash flow if energy prices rise from current levels."
    • Sterman spots a subtle turnaround underway - one that appears to have prompted Carl Icahn to keep adding to his CHK position this year - as the company has cut the cost to develop and operate a well by ~30% in the past few years.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM | 46 Comments
  • PBR

    Petrobras still a credit risk even as "comeback kid," Gimme Credit says

    • Petrobras (PBR -2.1%) is Gimme Credit's "comeback kid of the month" after raising $2.5B in its 100-year bond sale only weeks after reporting $16.7B in impairment charges amid lower oil prices and the ongoing corruption scandal.
    • But PBR's credit metrics have a long way to go, Gimme Credit says as it estimates the company faces a $7.8B free cash flow shortfall in FY 2015, before divestitures, despite billions in cash, loans and credit lines; PBR's total debt is $170B, and the firm notes that even adjusted debt totals $125B.
    • The firm notes that PBR is still a defendant in some U.S. class action lawsuits, and considers the legal fallout to remain a significant risk of additional liabilities to add to the already high debt profile.
    • Earlier: Another rate hike in Brazil with maybe more to come
     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM | 15 Comments
  • BABA

    Alibaba investing $193.6M in financial firm, creating JV

    • Shortly after the WSJ and other reported about a pending deal, Alibaba (BABA +0.2%) says it's investing RMB1.2B ($193.6M) in financial TV/newspaper owner China Business News (CBN) to "create a financial data and information services company that will help Chinese small and medium enterprises tap a rich mine of financial data."
    • The JV will leverage Alibaba's cloud services and analytics tools, and aim to give "a greater number of Chinese enterprises access to precious financial data that can be easily mined and analyzed for actionable investment and business decisions."
    • Meanwhile, Alipay is partnering with CBN to provide stock quotes in its apps (as previously reported), and CBN will launch a "wealth management information product" on the Taobao marketplace's mobile site/apps.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM | 4 Comments
  • ERIC

    Ericsson +3.4%; JPMorgan joins Citi in upgrading

    • A week after Citi upgraded Ericsson (NASDAQ:ERIC) on a belief U.S. wireless capex will improve, JPMorgan's Sandeep Deshpande has done the same.
    • Deshpande, who now has an Overweight rating and $12.20 target, observes Ericsson's Q1 U.S. equipment revenue was near a cyclical low, and expects recent spectrum auctions to boost U.S. capex. "Additionally in early '16 high quality low frequency spectrum will be auctioned meaning a new capacity investment cycle should start in '16."
    • He adds Ericsson's cost-cutting efforts should improve margins, and notes CEO Hans Vestberg recently stated industry consolidation should provide a margin lift.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM | 1 Comment
  • SBAC

    SBA Communications rises 4.2% on new $1B buyback plan

    • SBA Communications (NASDAQ:SBAC) is up 4.2% as it's authorized a new $1B stock repurchase plan.
    • The company had finished its last program, a $300M authorization, last month. The old plan saw the company buying back 1% of outstanding shares.
    • The company plans to retire shares bought back under the new plan, which has no deadline.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM | 1 Comment
  • GEVO

    Gevo's wood waste-derived jet fuel to be used in first test flight

    • Gevo (GEVO +10.6%) shoots higher after announcing that its patented wood waste derived jet fuel will be used in a first-ever test flight.
    • The test flight is part of a partnership with the Department of Agriculture supported Northwest Advanced Renewables Alliance, a five-year project striving to facilitate the development of renewable biojet and bioproduct industries using forest residuals that would otherwise become waste products.
    • Gevo makes isobutanol fuel from corn at its plant in Minnesota but has developed alternative processes that allow it to make the compound from the wood scraps left over from logging activities.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM | 1 Comment
  • S

    Dish Network, T-Mobile up on report of merger talk; Sprint slips

    • Dish Network (DISH +5.9%) and T-Mobile (TMUS +4.6%) are on the rise this morning -- and Sprint (NYSE:S) is down 4.2% -- in the wake of reports that Dish and T-Mobile are talking merger.
    • It's not the first time the two have been linked by observers due to strategic sense: T-Mobile needs spectrum and Dish Network has it, and Dish needs growth and broadband service that T-Mobile could provide as AT&T and DirecTV near the closing of their merger. (Though the broadband isn't a perfect fit.)
    • T-Mobile has been amassing wireless spectrum, and while Dish's Charlie Ergen has been circumspect as recently as this week about what the company would do with it, one thing he's made clear is that the company didn't plan to start a wireless network from scratch.
    • A deal may take some time in coming, in part because of its size -- both companies have $30B-plus market caps -- and the fact that the FCC prohibits strategic talks during spectrum auctions, leaving a window before the broadcast incentive auction for discussions.
    • Sprint, meanwhile, is trading down on fears that it could be left out in the cold, having a potential merger with T-Mobile dematerialize last year, and subscriber momentum that is likely to see it passed by T-Mo to fall to the fourth-largest carrier in the U.S., with a cash burn problem to boot.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM | 16 Comments
  • BKE

    Select retail stocks grinding out gains

    • A healthy round of reports from retail chains and more firming up of the labor market has the retail sector ahead of market averages
    • Outperformers include Buckle (BKE +3.4%), Five Below (FIVE +7.3%), Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF +1.8%), L Brands (LB +1.8%), American Eagle Outfitters (AEO +2.2%), Citi Trends (CTRN +2.1%), Express (EXPR +1.4%), Urban Outfitters (URBN +1.6%), Wayfair (W +1.3%), and TravelCenters of America (TA +0.9%).
    • The S&P Retail ETF (NYSEARCA:XRT) is also positive on the day with most broad market averages in the red.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • HRZN

    Horizon Technology Finance lower after pulling SBIC application

    • The company last night announced its withdrawal of an application for an SBA license to operate as a SBIC. Oppenheimer responds with a downgrade to Perform from Outperform.
    • HRZN -2.45%
     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM

  • Biglari Holdings +11% after tender offer issued by The Lion Fund

    • The Lion Fund issues a tender offer for up to 575K shares of Biglari Holdings at $420 per share.
    • The offer expires July 1.
    • Shares of Biglari Holdings are up 10.90% to $409.97.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • WRK

    Containerboard stocks slip

    • Containerboard stocks are off slightly as pricing concerns due to oversupply linger in the background.
    • The sector is also facing a headwind due to a new IRS proposal which would limit income for publicly traded partnerships.
    • MeadWestvaco (MWV) -1.4%, Rock-Tenn (RKT) -1.5%, Packaging Corp of America (NYSE:PKG) -1.1%, Graphic Packaging (NYSE:GPK) -1.1%, International Paper (NYSE:IP) -0.5%, KapStone Paper and Packaging (NYSE:KS) -0.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM | 6 Comments
  • ABB

    ABB shares jump on activist stake

    • Activist investor Cevian Capital has taken a stake of more than 3% in ABB (ABB +5.4%), sending its shares to their highest in more than six months.
    • "We think ABB is a good company where we see a large value potential," Cevian Capital managing partner Christer Gardell told Reuters.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • OXLC

    Oxford Lane Capital -6.5% after secondary

    • The company's 2.25M share secondary reportedly priced at $15.65.
    • OXLC -6.5% to $15.00 premarket.
    • Previously: Oxford Lane Capital sets capital raise (June 3)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM
  • MTP

    DARA BioSciences merges with Midatech Pharma; shares up 30% premarket

    • Thinly traded nano cap DARA BioSciences (DARA) merges with Oxford, UK-based Midatech Pharma PLC (AIM:MTPH). Each share of DARA will be converted into the right to receive 0.272 ordinary shares of Midatech plus one Contingent Value Right (CVR). All Midatech shares will be delivered to DARA stockholders as American Depositary Receipts (ADRs). Based on the current price of Midatech, the deal is worth ~$1.20 per DARA share. DARA shareholders will own ~16% of Midatech after the merger.
    • The CVRs will pay an aggregate of $5.7M in cash if sales milestones for DARA's Gelclair and Oravig are met in 2016 and 2017.
    • DARA is up 30% premarket on robust volume.

  • KZIA

    Preclinical study shows Novogen's TRXE-009 crosses blood-brain barrier

    • Nano cap Novogen (NVGN) reports that animal studies show that its experimental chemotherapy candidate, TRXE-009 (Trilexium), crosses the blood-brain barrier in therapeutic concentrations. The barrier is a defense mechanism that protects the brain from toxins. It prevents 98% of all drugs used in humans from reaching the brain which is problematic for treating brain cancer patients with pharmaceuticals.
    • The next step is to confirm that TRXE-009 kills brain cancer cells growing in the brain. A clinical trial is on tap for early 2016.
    • TRXE-009 is a pan-acting anti-cancer cytotoxic molecule in a family called super-benzopyrans. Its precise mechanism of action is unknown but it induces cell death in cancer cells with stem cell-like activity.
    • Shares are down 6% premarket on average volume.
    • Previously: Novogen up 13% premarket on positive brain cancer study results (May 8)
